Depends on what your hosting case is. If you&#39;re looking at uploading images and you&#39;re making them public, then a CDN can help make sure everyone has low-latency access and it&#39;s easy to set up: <a href="https://cloud.google.com/load-balancing/docs/https/adding-a-backend-bucket-to-content-based-load-balancing">https://cloud.google.com/load-balancing/docs/https/adding-a-backend-bucket-to-content-based-load-balancing</a>
If you&#39;re hosting a static site, there&#39;s no reason not to use Cloudflare in front of the bucket.

Hey, I had the same problem. what I had done is I had added my credit card details, but to use VM you need to &quot;upgrade&quot; the GCP billing section. This is just a one-click process and it doesn&#39;t charge us till we exhaust the current free credit. <br />Later after upgrading I had a problem that Mumbai zone doesn&#39;t have enough support, so I just stuck to the &quot;us central 1-a&quot; zone and it works fine now. I hope this helps.
kindly do not forget to remove your billing details post-use if you do not intend to pay post free credits are over and are just learning GCP for personal interest.
Also the date and time of the VM will be different but that&#39;s fine as long as you are not doing any time-sensitive tasks

Glad it helped you L U O N G S O N ;-)
Brilliant stuff again Joe... so say you want to edit a file but get &quot;permission denied&quot; message... you have to do a root command:<br><br>1. locate the folder or file inside FTP you&#39;re wanting to edit<br>2. copy the link - example: /opt/bitnami/apps/wordpress/htdocs/robots.txt<br>3. right-click file/folder and right down the permission (folders: 7xx Files:6xx...)<br>4. go to your shell command prompt tool through your domain SSH and type root command <br><br>sudo -i<br><br>5. change permissions to example: 777 (for folders) 666 (for files)... <br>chmod -R 666 /opt/bitnami/apps/wordpress/htdocs/robots.txt<br><br>6. FTP: DOWNLOAD/BACKUP A COPY OF &#39;OLD&#39; FOLDER/FILE ...do the necessary editing and save the new folder/file... Test to see everything is in working condition just like you want it ;-) <br><br>7. CHANGE BACK: Don&#39;t forget to change permissions back to what it was previously... example: chmod -R 664 /opt/bitnami/apps/wordpress/htdocs/robots.txt
Hi Isaac,<br>I am glad you found the tutorial helpful!<br>Thanks, <br>Joe

Hi Ardy - not open to the world, just open to all users on your system. That being said, it&#39;s best to use the lowest level of permissions required to accomplish your objective.

@VIETSOF TECH That essentially means that either the host name, or the ip address for the database is wrong. Check all your login info and make sure the SSH keys are on your computer and assigned properly through google cloud.
This is a great video! It has helped me so much. I want to add something for people who might have experienced an error where their permissions were denied. All you have to to is connect to the computer either using putty or the chrome console, and type this: sudo chmod 777 -R (directory that you want to edit). This will open the permissions up for filezilla to use. <br /><br /><br />Command breakdown<br />sudo - Makes sure the command is ran as an admin<br />chmod - Allows you to edit file permissions<br />777 - Allows full read/write/run privileges <br />-R - Makes it recursive to all directories so that you dont have to do this for every file inside the directory
Hi Gerald - I published a tutorial on fixing permission issues, which you can view here: <a href="https://www.onepagezen.com/fix-ftp-permission-errors-google-cloud/">https://www.onepagezen.com/fix-ftp-permission-errors-google-cloud/</a>

Setting up Google Cloud is so difficult for people just starting out.<br /><br /><br />You forgot to tell us that you DON&#39;T HAVE WRITE PERMISSIONS.<br /><br />To enable write permissions go to SSH in VM Instances, once you&#39;re inside SSH you type in the following.<br /><br /><br />sudo chmod 777 /var/www/html and it&#39;ll enable write permissions. When you&#39;re done with what you need to do change it back to 755

Awesome - thanks for sharing this!
Short version: <br />1. Download FileZilla (free version)<br />2. Download Putty Key Generator<br />3. Generate a Key<br />4. Save private key<br />4. Copy public key and add it to your Google Console Cloud Platform -&gt; Compute Engine -&gt; Metadata -&gt; SSH Keys<br /><a href="https://console.cloud.google.com/compute/metadata/sshKeys">https://console.cloud.google.com/compute/metadata/sshKeys</a><br />5. Open FileZilla. Edit -&gt; Settings -&gt; SFTP -&gt; Add key file (browse for private key location) -&gt; click Ok<br />6. In FileZilla host sftp://your_Google_Console_Cloud_Platform_ip and Username write the &quot;Key comment&quot; it from the Putty Key Generator.<br />7. Quck connect on the FileZilla
Awesome - I&#39;m glad to hear the tutorial was helpful for you!

Hi<br /><br />Go to APIs &amp; services -&gt; Library<br /><br /> Type DNS<br /> <br />Click on &quot;Google Cloud DNS API&quot;<br /><br />Click on &quot;Enable&quot;

What about how to add a second domain, when you generate a second or third domain, it gives new nameservers, such as 1st = A, 2nd = B, 3rd = C etc etc.<br /><br />So when you goto cpanel and try and add these addon domains, it says nameserver problem.<br />BUT if you change the scond name server ns-cloud-b2 to say ns-cloud-a1 to match the main instance for all 4...<br /><br />Google says:<br />Warning: Your NS records do not match the nameservers for your zone. This is not common and could cause problems.<br /><br />AND still in cpanel it says nameservers don&#39;t match.<br /><br />It seems impossible to use addon domains with Gcloud?<br /><br />Spent 3 days on it watched dozens of videos and hundreds of websites, not one will explain how to successfully add addon domains using only one VM instance + Cpanel.

This is a perfect use case for cloud computing. This used to be called ‚Äúbatch‚Äù processing ‚Äì scheduling super expensive compute resources where the output would eventually come back to the user completed ‚Äì in a day, a week, who knows. God forbid the user had a parameter, a comma, out of place that made the job abort‚Ä¶ Doh! Then the next day they would get a crack at running a corrected job.<br /><br />Now it‚Äôs literally done in real-time with hundreds of virtual machines that spin up on-demand and chew through the task while the expensive, hard to find, and hard to keep human resource is getting ready for their next step. Concentration is maintained and output is maximized without breaking the bank with a major capital investment that used to take the board of directors to sign off on.<br /><br />I LOVE it!

@Jake Wisemen you go to the cm instance, click on it, then, at the top of the page click edit.. scroll down to ask keys and click <a href="http://add.you/">add.you</a> can paste the key there. The key you can generate from putty (on windows). Download putty, then there&#39;s an exe like puttygen.exe start it, add your email in the comments section, click generate, copy the text from the text box at the top into the Google console, and save the private key to your pc...tony needs a video about this:)

@Tony Teaches Tech I have the same problem and I don&#39;t know much coding to rectify it. Could you give me a direction to how I can fix this? Thanks
I had the same problem, I just delete the &quot;default&quot; file in /etc/nginx/sites-enabled and restart the web server with &quot;sudo systemctl restart nginx&quot; and the problem disappeared like magic hehe
replace line 6 on the conf file with server_name &lt;your.ip.address&gt;;<br />test nginx with &quot;sudo nginx -t&quot;<br />restart nginx with &quot;sudo systemctl restart nginx&quot;
@Tony Teaches Tech Hi Tony. Thanks so much for this video. I have attempted to do this 20+ times and I also get the default Nginx page. Any insight would be very much appreciated.<br />Best, C.
Seems like Nginx is still serving the default index.html page at /var/www/html. Are you sure you installed WordPress in that directory? Maybe you have both an index.html and index.php file in that directory. I would look at that first.
Okay I‚Äôll try again... thanks for the answer, Tony..
@Rahul Rajeev Are you sure that you restarted the nginx server to apply your configuration changes?<br />sudo systemctl restart nginx<br />It&#39;s possible if you skipped this step, nginx will still be serving the default Nginx page. Please let me know if that works for you!

Hi there. I&#39;ll do my best to answer your questions.<br />1) &quot;Google Cloud Free Tier is also available for external IP addresses that are being used by VM instances. In-use external IP addresses are available without additional cost until you have used a number of hours equal to the total hours in the current month. Usage calculations are combined across all in-use external IP addresses across all regions. Google Cloud Free Tier for in-use external IP addresses applies to all non-preemptible instance types, not just f1-micro instances&quot; <a href="https://cloud.google.com/free/docs/gcp-free-tier">https://cloud.google.com/free/docs/gcp-free-tier</a><br />2) This video shows you how to send free email if you purchase your domain name with Google Domains <a href="https://youtu.be/RbT28X0wiRw">https://youtu.be/RbT28X0wiRw</a><br />3) I will look into Nginx caching<br />4) GCP has built-in detailed VM usage statistics in the dashboard, no need for additional monitors<br />5) Having a bit of disk space for swap is not a bad idea IMO

Hi there. You shouldn&#39;t necessarily update PHP, but rather install a new version alongside the system version. I&#39;m assuming your using Nginx because you commented on this video...<br /><br />sudo apt update<br />sudo apt install php7.4 php7.4-fpm<br /><br />Next, edit your Nginx config file to reflect the new PHP version<br /><br />systemctl reload nginx<br /><br />That should do it.

awesome
impressive thank you
BigQuery is the storage and analytics in one. Because of it being designed for extremely large data sets there&#39;s a fairly heavy cost to running queries against it. If your data set is relatively small (GBs, and potentially TBs depending on schema) a query might be able to finish in the tens of seconds neighborhood. I.e. still not real time, or even real near time. You can, and what we recommend even, build some real time analytics into whichever piece is pulling the data into BigQuery. So in a Cloud Function for example.<br /><br />Grain of salt, this all depends on use case of course. If you only care about seeing reports on the data every minute, for example, you may be able to get away with using BigQuery directly, but I&#39;d still suggest using some other data warehouse for real time.<br /><br />Hopefully this helps. If you want to connect on LinkedIn if you have more questions I&#39;m happy to chat more.

TO ANYBODY WITH THE ISSUE OF HAVING THE WRONG PASSWORD - when you set your windows password for the first time, it will popup with a username, change that username to something simple. After you OK the username, it then gives you the password. Copy that password, and when you boot up, it will show the username of a nonexistent computer cloud. Change that username in more options on windows, and there should be that option on Mac as well. Then you can paste the password. Msg me if you&#39;re still confused.
don‚Äôt forget that your server ip is different now, so u have to use your server ip and put it in your proxy

You wouldn&#39;t want to and no. Dataproc is a manager Hadoop cluster which performs better with a huge dataset - which is generally batch data. Plus running a DataProc cluster is very expensive. If you want to process streaming data, you are better off using Pub/Sub or a Kafka Cluster

NO.1 You need to grant access for three users so that they can view and edit table data on a Cloud
 <br />Spanner instance. What should you do?
 <br />A. Run gcloud iam roles describe roles/spanner.viewer - -project my-project. Add the users to a new
 <br />group. Add the group to the role.
 <br />B. Run gcloud iam roles describe roles/spanner.databaseUser. Add the users to the role.
 <br />C. Run gcloud iam roles describe roles/spanner.viewer - -project my-project. Add the users to the
 <br />role.
 <br />D. Run gcloud iam roles describe roles/spanner.databaseUser. Add the users to a new group. Add the
 <br />group to the role.<br /><br />What would be the answer B or D??
C
Every employee of your company has a Google account. Your operational team needs to manage a
 <br />large number of instances on Compute Engine. Each member of this team needs only administrative
 <br />access to the servers. Your security team wants to ensure that the deployment of credentials is
 <br />operationally efficient and must be able to determine who accessed a given instance. What should
 <br />you do?
 <br />A. Generate a new SSH key pair. Give the private key to each member of your team. Configure the
 <br />public key in the metadata of each instance.
 <br />B. Ask each member of the team to generate a new SSH key pair and to send you their public key.
 <br />Use a configuration management tool to deploy those keys on each instance.
 <br />C. Ask each member of the team to generate a new SSH key pair and to add the public key to their
 <br />Google account. Grant the ‚Äúcompute.osAdminLogin‚Äù role to the Google group corresponding to this
 <br />team.
 <br />D. Generate a new SSH key pair. Give the private key to each member of your team. Configure the
 <br />public key as a project-wide public SSH key in your Cloud Platform project and allow project-wide
 <br />public SSH keys on each instance.<br /><br />What would be the answer C or D

Or did it? :) Anyways, sentdex, great series of series of videos. I&#39;ve started with machine learning, and by now, I&#39;m hooked. :) Great stuff. Keep them coming.
Yes it&#39;s possible to code on a local machine. I&#39;m on Windows and use a Vagrant box with Ubuntu 14.04, virtualenv and code in PyCharm in my work. After launching Ubuntu via Vagrant and connecting to it using PuTTy you act as if you&#39;ve connected to Google virtual machine (as in this video). But to run python scripts in PyCharm additionally I also had to enter path to credentials file there (Run-&gt;Edit Configurations-&gt;Environment variables-&gt;add key &#39;GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS&#39; and path to json file (in my case &#39;/vagrant/....&#39;). P.s. Code in the video may be outdated or doesn&#39;t work on python3 - see comment by Doug Beney (worked for me). P.p.s. Thank you Sentdex!
Does anybody know if it is possible to run the API from a local machine. I have an Ubuntu machine with tensorflow-GPU and google cloud installed. <br /><br />I have created a project in google cloud, generated a key and enabled vision but I get &quot;Could not automatically determine credentials.&quot; <br /><br />Is what I&#39;m trying to do possible or am I making a stupid error?<br /><br />I answered my own question by actually reading the link that comes with the error. :p<br /><br />Follow the instructions the instructions in the above video until you have input the path for the key and then:<br /><br />Install Google Cloud SDK on your machine:<br /><a href="https://cloud.google.com/sdk/docs/quickstart-debian-ubuntu">https://cloud.google.com/sdk/docs/quickstart-debian-ubuntu</a><br /><br />Run &#39;gcloud auth application-default login&#39; in a terminal and a browser window will come up asking you to sign your life away to google-ai.<br /><br />Then your machine should be authorized to use the API.<br /><br /><br />Great Video and happy computing.
1. It&#39;s not really root, but it&#39;s password-less sudo. You can just do su and be root too though. you&#39;re free to run it however you like though. <br />2. I didn&#39;t catch a &quot;bounds.&quot; Maybe I am blind :P. If it&#39;s there I&#39;ll be super excited.
You actually are root:<br />1 - you&#39;re command line starts with the user name, which in this case is root@...<br />2 - you have the &#39;#&#39; in the beginning of your prompt - which indicates that you are running as root<br />3 - in the first tutorial you entered &quot;sudo su&quot; - which makes you root user<br /><br />Type &#39;exit&#39; or hit Ctrl-d - and you&#39;ll be back on your regular user<br /><br />Update us regarding the bounds ;)<br /><br />And - thanks for your great tutorials - im learning something new every time!
Oh, I didn&#39;t notice I stayed as root after showing it, whoops. You don&#39;t need to be root, you can just use sudo where necessary. If the bounds really work, I will update for sure with drawing squares or something around the objects.
After poking into bounds, that sounds like it&#39;s what it should be, but it still returns nothing. I tried label._bounds.vertices, and it&#39;s all still empty :(((

yup same error here.
Make sure your Line 5 (private_key) is all in one &quot;continuous line&quot;. E.g., make sure there are no &#39;returns&#39; spreading the key across multiples lines. Mine was formatted with \n newline characters however was still split across two lines (as if somebody hit return halfway through private_key string). Once I deleted the return and put the key on a single line, no problem.
fixed it, still didn&#39;t pass :(
I used nano for editing, but only when I saved the json file again using vi it did work :)
Maybe too late for an answer but you used the path to root /root/gcloudstuff/apikey.json but you are more likely to have the apikey stored in your home directory. the command would be <br />export GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS=/home/*random_number_of _folders*/apikey.json. try to use the full path from root to your file. Had the same problem with the root directory

Nope, you can run it from your home computer too if you like. I chose to use the VM since it&#39;s super cheap anyway, and it&#39;s easier to do the tutorial if everyone&#39;s on the same OS, but you can use the APIs from wherever you like.

Thanks for this post. A lot of changes has occurred at API level. I have to make some changes in order to make it work. Here is my <a href="http://visionex.py/">visionex.py</a>:<br /><br />import io<br />from <a href="http://google.cloud/">google.cloud</a> import vision<br />from <a href="http://google.cloud.vision/">google.cloud.vision</a> import types<br />vision_client = vision.ImageAnnotatorClient()<br />file_name = &#39;kimberly-guilfoyle-2.jpg&#39;<br />with io.open(file_name,&#39;rb&#39;) as image_file:<br /> content = image_file.read()<br /> image = types.Image(content=content)<br />response = vision_client.label_detection(image=image)<br />labels = response.label_annotations<br />for label in labels:<br /> print(label.description, label.score)<br /><br /><br />root@nlp1:~/gcloudstuff/visionex# python <a href="http://visionex.py/">visionex.py</a> <br />(u&#39;hair&#39;, 0.9773183465003967)<br />(u&#39;eyebrow&#39;, 0.9387233257293701)<br />(u&#39;human hair color&#39;, 0.9043058753013611)<br />(u&#39;beauty&#39;, 0.8982101678848267)<br />(u&#39;chin&#39;, 0.8967102766036987)<br />(u&#39;hairstyle&#39;, 0.8900614976882935)<br />(u&#39;long hair&#39;, 0.8221617937088013)<br />(u&#39;forehead&#39;, 0.8207109570503235)<br />(u&#39;layered hair&#39;, 0.7995803952217102)<br />(u&#39;black hair&#39;, 0.7725696563720703)

Client module no longer exists try the below code:<br />import io<br />import os<br />from <a href="http://google.cloud/">google.cloud</a> import vision<br />from <a href="http://google.cloud.vision/">google.cloud.vision</a> import types<br />os.environ[&quot;GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS&quot;]=&quot;your key.json&quot;<br />path = &#39;test.jpg&#39;<br />vision_client = vision.ImageAnnotatorClient()<br />with io.open(path, &#39;rb&#39;) as image_file:<br /> content = image_file.read()<br /> image = types.Image(content=content)<br /> response = vision_client.text_detection(image=image)<br />texts = response.text_annotations<br />for text in texts:<br /> print(text.description)

If you guys are working with different os and want to make that GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS work without any incompatibility issue you can do something like this in your program: <br /><br />import os<br />os.environ[&quot;GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS&quot;] = &quot;path_to_your_.json_credential_file&quot;

Hiw dies google cloud print work for nom wireless printers
Open the Excel file in Google Chrome Browser and the print. You can use Google Cloud Printer only for printing the documents/ files / web pages which Google Chrome can show. If your web page is opened in Internet Explorer or Firefox, Google Cloud Printer cannot be used for printing.

Google Cloud Print, Google&#39;s cloud-based printing solution will no longer be supported as of December 31, 2020. Beginning January 1, 2021, devices across all operating systems will not be able to print using Cloud Print. We recommend that you find an alternative print solution with your respective platform&#39;s printing infrastructure.

Hi Aaron; when you say &quot;instances&quot; do you mean Cloud SQL or Cloud Run? You can have autoscaling Cloud Run <i>services</i> and autoscaling Cloud SQL <i>instances</i> . There are limits on the maximum number of connections for Cloud SQL which also may affect your setup <a href="https://cloud.google.com/sql/docs/quotas#postgresql">https://cloud.google.com/sql/docs/quotas#postgresql</a>
‚Äã@Aaron Free Solutions like pgBouncer or other postgres or mysql specific things may help with the general compounding concurrency issues. More details questions like this are best directed to the google-cloud-run and google-cloud-sql tags on StackOverflow, rather than Youtube comments :)
Hey Katie, thanks for the reply! I forgot that Cloud SQL could auto sale as well, in this case I meant Cloud Run container instances. I may be misunderstanding how Cloud Run works, but my understanding is if you have a service that would traditionally be a Django server on an IaaS setup like Google Compute Engine, you set your service concurrency to 1, and got 1000 requests, Cloud Run would boot up 1000 container instances to handle this traffic, which at least on CloudSQL for PostgreSQL would potentially be over the default max connection limit for even the the most expensive instance database instance type, as it reserves some of its connections for internal ops. Just curious if there‚Äôs a good way to deal with this without an unmanaged pgBouncer instance on between.
@Katie McLaughlin Totally, thanks for pointing me in the right direction.
Great video and great work on Cloud Run! It is by far my favorite serverless cloud service. I do have one question though. When using Cloud Run with Django, how would you manage connections for a SQL database? This is something I typically struggle with when modeling a serverless + managed SQL setup, since different spawned instances usually can&#39;t reuse each other&#39;s database connections and spawning too many instances with different connections may be hard for a SQL database to keep up with. I know that Cloud Run instances can serve a limited number of requests greater than 1, but at high(ish) scale I could still see database connection management being an issue.

the price for vm instance is fixed at monthly rate for sustained use. so the only variable cost is the network which is very cheap unless you have millions monthly visitors and do not cache content. storage isn&#39;t free but free tier quota should be adequate for small/medium websites. If you are using Google Domains and need to link your Domain to the IP just go to &quot;Website -&gt; Forward to an existing webpage -&gt; Enter IP in the Website URL field -&gt; click Forward&quot;.

It&#39;s still free if you fully use your VM 24/7. Quote from free tier doc:<br /><br /><br />&quot;Google Cloud Free Tier is also available for external IP addresses that are being used by VM instances. In-use external IP addresses are available without additional cost until you have used a number of hours equal to the total hours in the current month. Usage calculations are combined across all in-use external IP addresses. Google Cloud Free Tier for in-use external IP addresses applies to all instance types, not just f1-micro instances.&quot;<br /><br />The external IP was charged on my usage bill but then was deducted under &quot;Spending based discounts&quot;

it&#39;s not -1, but -l (as in lowercase L). Typing it in should look like &quot;sudo fallocate -l( lowercase L) 1G /swapfile&quot;. It confused me as well when I first tried it lol. (Comment is a bit late but hope it helps)

WARNING FOR STACKDRIVER AGENT - IT IS NOT FREE: I really loved this tutorial and did everything on it. 3 months into my free trial account and I noticed most of my credits were gone. I only had 74usd left from the 300 USD. I had 5 vm&#39;s running on the f1 micro processor at 30GB.This was to be expected. But the real drainer for most of my credits in 3 months was the Stackdriver Agent. It cost me 110ish USD to run for all my VM&#39;s. Install at your own risk, especially if you go into the non-free tier. If you need to uninstall it (I hope this works) run this command on your machine: <br />sudo apt-get purge stackdriver-agent<br /><br />I also removed the google monitor flags from 1 back to 0. If I need to do anything please share with everyone.

That&#39;s awesome!<br /><br />Just a small share for my situation:<br /><br />1) I have registered my domain via Cloudflare with full SSL on. Puedo en un sola VM de google Cloud subir varios sitios WP de distintos dominios ?
Hola Eduardo, si puedes acceder a la ra√≠z del servidor de varias formas SSH, FTP. No obstante con WordPress Bitnami o Click to Deploy en Google Cloud el proceso de instalar por fuera de la ra√≠z no est√° disponible en proceso de instalaci√≥n, para poder lograr esto tendr√≠as que crear una instancia e instalar todo lo necesario para tener WordPress. Ahora cuando instalas WordPress utilizando Bitnami o Click to Deploy, se instala en la IP asignada para la VM Instance, podr√≠as trabajar el sitio en esa IP, y apuntar el dominio cuando est√© lista y aprobada por el cliente. Pr√≥ximamente montaremos un tutorial sobre como acceder por FTP pero te recomiendo que veas este link por lo pronto (<a href="https://www.onepagezen.com/google-cloud-ftp-filezilla-quick-start/)">https://www.onepagezen.com/google-cloud-ftp-filezilla-quick-start/)</a>. Referente a los correos estos simplemente los configuras en la zona DNS que creaste a trav√©s de los registros MX recuerda que estos registros deben ingresarse primero la prioridad espacio y despu√©s el valor. Por defecto Google Cloud tiene deshabilitado el env√≠o de correos por php mail, por lo cual para que tus correos desde el sitio web funcione debes instalar un plugin como WP SMTP Mail o Zoho Mail si utilizas la plataforma de Zoho. Saludos

@eduardo venegas te recomiendo que mires este articulo (<a href="https://www.onepagezen.com/fix-ftp-permission-errors-google-cloud/)">https://www.onepagezen.com/fix-ftp-permission-errors-google-cloud/)</a> sobre todo en los comentarios, ya que los pasos que muestra este articulo solo te sirve para archivos espec√≠ficos y se hace muy tedioso de manejar, pero en los comentarios te dan la forma de agregar un usuario que pueda controlar todo.  &quot; y despues &quot;sudo chown -R username:www-data /opt/bitnami/apps/wordpress/htdocs/&quot;. Saludos

Hola Antonio para restablecer o cambiar la contrase√±a WordPress Bitnami, debes usar el script bnconfig, que se encuentra en: &quot;/opt/bitnami/apps/wordpress/bnconfig&quot;. Para cambiar la contrase√±a, debes ejecutar: &quot;sudo ./bnconfig --userpassword NEW_PASSWORD&quot;. Te recomiendo estos links: <a href="https://docs.bitnami.com/aws/apps/wordpress/administration/reset-wp-admin-password/%C2%A0,%C2%A0https://docs.bitnami.com/aws/apps/wordpress/administration/change-reset-password/%C2%A0">https://docs.bitnami.com/aws/apps/wordpress/administration/reset-wp-admin-password/ , https://docs.bitnami.com/aws/apps/wordpress/administration/change-reset-password/ </a>. Recuerda siempre manejar contrase√±as seguras. Saludos

Hola Leo, a mi la pagina me aparece y verificando los DNS est√°n apuntando correctamente a Google Cloud. Lo que observo es que aparece este error &quot;Error establishing a database connection&quot;, este puede ser causado por varios factores uno de ellos haber editado los datos mal del archivo wp-config.php otro que es muy com√∫n es que el disco de la VM Instance se haya llenado, para verificar esto puedes ingresar por SSH, accedes como root con el comando &quot;sudo -i&quot; y luego colocas el comando &quot;df -h&quot; para ver el uso del disco, si esta lleno lo primero que te recomiendo es que detengas la VM Instancia, despu√©s dentro de Compute Engine &gt; Disk selecciones el disco correspondiente a tu instancia y das clic, despu√©s haces clic en el bot√≥n de editar y ah√≠ aumentas es el tama√±o del disco y clic en guardar, una vez hecho vas a iniciar nuevamente tu VM Instance e ingresas nuevamente por SSH y vas a dar los siguientes comandos &quot;sudo -i&quot;, &quot;sudo growpart /dev/sda 1&quot;, &quot;sudo resize2fs /dev/sda1&quot; y por ultimo reinicias apache &quot;sudo /opt/bitnami/<a href="http://ctlscript.sh/">ctlscript.sh</a> restart apache&quot; (Este ultimo comando aplica solo para la versison de WordPress Bitnami). Espero te sirva. Saludos

Hola Deisy, debes crear en el Zona DNS, los registros MX, TXT, A o CNAME, o cualquier otro tipo de registro que necesites, y que previamente tenias configurado en tu dominio. Este video muestra el proceso para por ejemplo crear correos corporativos gratis con Zoho mail y como se editan los registros MX, tal vez te pueda servir de gu√≠a: <a href="https://youtu.be/lD1GKad1bBE?t=423">https://youtu.be/lD1GKad1bBE?t=423</a>. Debes tener en cuenta que por ejemplo en los registros MX se coloca primero la prioridad y luego el destino, y en los registros TXT el valor debe ir entre comillas. Saludos

I&#39;ve been able to make sense of the documentation(<a href="https://cloud.google.com/datastore/docs/">https://cloud.google.com/datastore/docs/</a>) plus there are sample applications to explore for various platforms (via client APIs) including PHP. If you go to google&#39;s API explorer you&#39;ll see that the Datastore API is at version 1 (<a href="https://developers.google.com/apis-explorer/#search/datastore/datastore/v1/">https://developers.google.com/apis-explorer/#search/datastore/datastore/v1/</a>). <br />I&#39;m building a tool that integrates with Datastore via its REST APIs and its going smoothly. Its not for everyone though; you should look into Firebase (also owned by Google) there are tonnes of tutorials out there and its easier to pick up than most. Firebase has its draw backs if you&#39;re coming from a SQL background but its good for a lot of use cases (for my current project it was a toss-up between Firebase and Datastore; we went with Datastore b/c of its support for SQL-like queries).
Yes, GCP needs to invest in forming a following especially outside the experienced developer realm.

Third year university Computer Science majors and programmers understand the jargon, and at this level of commitment to the trade are more likely to not be mischievous. I&#39;m only guessing. I want to back up my MacBook hard drive to the cloud is all, like Time Machine does every day with ChronoSync ‚Ä¶ <a href="https://www.econtechnologies.com/chronosync/overview.html">https://www.econtechnologies.com/chronosync/overview.html</a> ‚Ä¶ and I may end up purchasing a commercial product to do so. Too much could go wrong and then not reliable to accomplish on my own; I don&#39;t know enough to have confidence with Google or Amazon Cloud.
Google Datastore documentation is a mess or non-existing. Its almost impossible to find coders out there who know about Google Datastore. As a small startup we have sped two months trying to find someone who coud make a simple client database, with a PHP page on an App Engine interacting with a Datastore DB. There is no info, no examples, not turtotials, only a bunch of files on github having alien code insid. You dont knw where to start and where to end - only info is what is in the middle. So far Datastore is a Goolgle flop, I tink no one is using it, no one can develop with it, newer versions are not backward compatible - in short stay clear og Google Cloud, its not even in beta but rather an experimental thing.

Cold Storage pricing like Amazon Glacier or Google Nearline somehow is only more cost effective in end-user archiving scenarios when having a byte-sequence of unstructured data smaller than around 600 GB. Somehow even the Google pricing calculator can&#39;t beat CrashPlan&#39;s yearly pricing. So I think neither Google nor Amazons AWS has a good alternative for what CrashPlan is to end-user archiving needs.<br /><br />for nearline (why can&#39;t we directly save to coldline?) datastreams of roughly half a million object in a sequence of roughly 1700 Gigabytes other solutions seem to be more effective if you only want to archive.

@kupangjc apaka firebase termasuk google cloud apa tidak mas?
Beda Google Drive focusnya hanya di storage service, sedangkan Google Cloud lebih luas meliputi computing, database, storage dst
@Indra Aang nope, firebase terkhusus untuk storing data, tapi pemrosesannya memanfaatkan gcp untuk akses data, salah satunya GCF(google cloud function) ini pake node js untuk mengakses function firebase berbentuk API
Lebih baik google cloud atau google Drive?
Pricingnya gimana ya gan
@Bryan Dev tergantung lokasi data center, resource yang digunakan: jumlah core CPU, RAM, storage dst. Lihat pricing calculatornya di sini: <a href="https://cloud.google.com/products/calculator">https://cloud.google.com/products/calculator</a>
@kupangjc wah compute engine nya mahal juga yah pdhl syaa cumn pakai 1 instance small. Bisa 17$/bulan.

Azure ftw
it will be deleted like when you format your computer, So you will need to back up your stuff before deleting the instance. Students use it to test their codes and not for writing the code directly.
The philosophy of Cloud Computing is to separate storage and compute power so that you can turn on and off the computing power as and when you need it. So it is advisable to use cloud storage to store your code and spin up a compute instance, use it and turn it off and persist data in cloud storage and connect to cloud storage again when you need to spin up another compute instance. With an amazing Petabyte scale bidirectional network, this does not take too much time.
What about the project or code written a VM and then deleted the VM will the code remains on the system ?

For months I had this problem. My app was growing but I couldn&#39;t setup billing. I tried several debit cards. Finally, I reached out to Google&#39;s support team and they said that they only accept credit cards in India.
Wait, what!? Only accepts credit cards from India?
If you are in India, this long talking is useless for you. I use app engine for my project. The problem is in India and we have chip based debit card and which Google doesn&#39;t verify. And also they don&#39;t have other options like verify bank account directly. So I highly recommend you to go to your bank and ask them for a international card before starting out. Rest of the things are mentioned in the docs. And the problem you will face is not mentioned here and neither in the docs. So good luck

For those working with this have trouble with the GRANT, mysql in the latest versions do not allow for the implicit user creation any longer. the commands must be split, and the user requires a domain now. so his example would be:<br /><br />CREATE USER &#39;wordpressuser&#39;@&#39;localhost&#39; IDENTIFIED BY &#39;Secure1234!&#39;;<br /><br />Then<br /><br />GRANT ALL ON wordpress.* TO &#39;wordpressuser&#39;@&#39;localhost&#39;;<br /><br />I hope this helps...
If you&#39;re using WordPress there are some plugings for that.

For those of you who are confused as to where the micro instance is:<br />Under Machine configuration &gt; Series<br />Select N1<br /><br />Under Machine configuration &gt; Machine type<br />Select f1-micro

Valerie, Let me tackle these questions for you, 1. I did a whole series of videos on salary negotiations. I was told would get feedback from that and see what the potential next steps are. sw, infrastructure is obviously at the heart of GCP. So practicing for this type of interview, I want you to go more in depth on understanding and being able to connect the history of Google to current times,. Erik, the ABP (Administrative Business Partner) positions on the cloud teams should not differ from other teams. These roles are all about your ability to listen, collaborate, prioritize, stay organized, streamline processes, and anticipate needs! I hope this helps!

@Huy Tran GCP is extremely reliable and extremely fast, but it is NOT cheap. Hi Dave! The old way of setting up the SSL (like in this tutorial) doesn&#39;t work with cloud flare. I recommend using the new method, using this command: sudo /opt/bitnami/bncert-tool <br>Here&#39;s some more information on it: <a href="https://docs.bitnami.com/google/how-to/generate-install-lets-encrypt-ssl/">https://docs.bitnami.com/google/how-to/generate-install-lets-encrypt-ssl/</a>

The Cloud DNS costs a few cents, each month. Also, any Egress data that you use over the 1GB costs a few cents per GB of data. Here is more info: <a href="https://cloud.google.com/vpc/network-pricing">https://cloud.google.com/vpc/network-pricing</a> <br><br>Oh yeah, in my video, I used an SSD. I recommend you go back to a 30GB HDD to save money if you don&#39;t want the extra cost.<br><br>You can look at your bill and see what the breakdown is.

Hi George, I&#39;m sorry to hear you had to pay so much. Did you make sure to use the f1-micro VM instance? Also, did you make sure you only have 1 VM instance total? Hi Amanda, 100%, yes. Once you setup Wordpress, it will be exactly like if you hosted anywhere else! Now, there are a few things to consider here #1 the Free Tier allows up to 1GB of data egress (meaning data downloaded to your viewers), if you go over 1GB, then it&#39;s $0.12 per GB. The other thing to consider is #2: if you have LOTS of visitors like 1500 visits a day, then you will need to upgrade your Virtual Machine to handle the additional simultaneous load. But honestly, if you host ANYWHERE if you get this kind of traffic, they will make upgrade your hosting package as well. Also, if you&#39;re getting that many visitors, you&#39;ll be making lots and lots of money and can afford to upgrade your Google Cloud Virtual Machine to provide you customer a smoother experience. FYI: My other website is currently hosted on Google Cloud, and I am currently working to add the feature to sell products on my website, check out my new website here: <a href="http://www.pixelstabbers.com/">www.PixelStabbers.com</a>

Great video but please add the steps to renew the SSL certificate. I added some comments below but here is the what I did to renew the SSL certificate (it expires in three months so you have to repeat it). The one that worked was: 1) use this command: sudo /opt/bitnami/bncert-tool 2) agree to continue and click Y <br />Here&#39;s some more information on it: <a href="https://docs.bitnami.com/google/how-to/generate-install-lets-encrypt-ssl/">https://docs.bitnami.com/google/how-to/generate-install-lets-encrypt-ssl/</a>

Hi Umar Falalu! Thanks for watching the tutorial! The old way of setting up the SSL (like in this tutorial) doesn&#39;t work with cloudflare. Hi Mike, try this: <br /><br />Open your httpd-app.conf for editing by running the following command:<br /><br />sudo nano /opt/bitnami/apps/wordpress/conf/httpd-app.conf<br /><br />Once inside the file, locate the following line:<br /><br />Include ‚Äú/opt/bitnami/apps/wordpress/conf/banner.conf‚Äù<br /><br />Next, comment out the line by adding a # symbol in front of it ‚Äì as shown:<br /><br /><a href="http://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=%23include">#Include</a> ‚Äú/opt/bitnami/apps/wordpress/conf/banner.conf‚Äù<br /><br />Next, save and exit the file (CTRL+X then CTRL+Y), and restart your Apache server by running the following command:<br /><br />sudo /opt/bitnami/<a href="http://ctlscript.sh/">ctlscript.sh</a> restart

Update for Step 5: Removing the Bitnami Banner - the terminal script should be: &#39;sudo /opt/bitnami/apps/wordpress/bnconfig.disabled --disable_banner 1&#39;

Hi DJ Only-Vibe! Thanks for your comment, GCP really can be 100% FREE. Hi P Costopoulos! Thanks for your comment, GCP really can be 100% FREE. GCP has a generous free tier (please see the break down here: <a href="https://youtu.be/fJJL9icHCxY?t=65">https://youtu.be/fJJL9icHCxY?t=65</a> ). I have been running several websites running this way for almost two years now. But you need to keep an eye on your egress data. We have a Learning Management System website (www.PixelStabbers.com) that is still perfectly fine on the free tier. For our other websites that have more static content like <a href="http://utechpia.com/">UTECHPIA.com</a> and <a href="http://kidphotofun.com/">KidPhotoFun.com</a> those Websites are way under the minimum of the GCP‚Äôs free tier. Hi John guo, thanks for watching my video and thanks for your feedback. I did a TERRIBLE job at explaining this part. The estimate price on the Bitnami setup screen doesn&#39;t take into consideration that we&#39;re going to be taking advantage of Google&#39;s Free Tier. Since we are using a f1-micro CPU on (us-west1, us-central1, or us-east1), then the CPU is free. Here&#39;s more details of the free tier: <a href="https://cloud.google.com/free/docs/gcp-free-tier">https://cloud.google.com/free/docs/gcp-free-tier</a> . Let me know if you have any other feedback, questions.

FYI: The method in this video is out dated, there are better ways to setup FREE Hosting on GCP now. There is a new Bitnami Certificate Tool called &quot;bncert-tool&quot; it is super easy to use and it works better with CloudFlare CDN. Also you don&#39;t need to waste money paying for Google Cloud DNS Service anymore. Hi BkbnFS! Thanks for your comment, GCP really can be 100% FREE. GCP has a generous free tier (please see the break down here: <a href="https://youtu.be/fJJL9icHCxY?t=65">https://youtu.be/fJJL9icHCxY?t=65</a> ). I have been running several websites running this way for almost two years now. But you need to keep an eye on your egress data. We have a Learning Management System website (www.PixelStabbers.com) that is still perfectly fine on the free tier. For our other websites that have more static content like <a href="http://utechpia.com/">UTECHPIA.com</a> and <a href="http://kidphotofun.com/">KidPhotoFun.com</a> those Websites are way under the minimum of the GCP‚Äôs free tier. Thanks a lot.
isn&#39;T that what Googles Container OS Image in GCE is for?
@Imran Zunzani of course you‚Äôre right, thanks for clarifying
@Christian Baumann <br />Google&#39;s Container OS is for the instance on which Kubernetes or Docker runs, while Alpine is for creating the container (image) to run on Kubernetes/Docker.<br />Google&#39;s Container OS reduces the attack surface for the machine on which you run containers while bases like Alpine reduces the attack surface for the containers themselves.
üëç<br />Also use the minimal container base image eg. Alpine, to reduce attack surface due to vulnerabilities.
I was thinking the same hmm!
&quot;Top 3&quot; ;-)
They are phasing that one out it seems to me.
You did not mention GAE Flex ü§î
if they did not give it away, it would not have democratized the cloud, all clouds, public, private, and hybrid. the beauty of K8s is it abstracted all these platforms, and enabled new platforms to built on top of it. e.g. Knative or in GCP Cloud run.
My personal view (TM), is that Cloud Run sounds like where things are headed. I know kubernetes Ok but feel like it&#39;s rather complex for what it does. As a developer, I don&#39;t want to manage kubernetes through a manifest, I have my smooth running docker images and just want to run them and let the cloud provider deal with the logistics and give me a nice web or platform UI that lets me &quot;tune&quot; how the containers run. The UI should be complete, and simple and fast, with alerts and limits I can set. That&#39;s my opinion only and does not reflect the opinions of anyone else I know including past, present or future employers.
I like it that you like GKE! It will only get better with time!
Sometimes I feel that you guys gave away too much by open-sourcing K8S. Honestly - it&#39;s an absolutely amazing tool, using something like &quot;Cloud Run&quot; feels like a step-back sometimes, like you are trying to get back control of your customers. GKE is such a perfect middle-ground between &quot;do it yourself&quot; and &quot;fully hosted&quot; option - I&#39;m not even sure there could be any product that would make it sensible to switch to something else. Any &quot;auxiliary&quot; tools, like CloudRegistry, Logging, Debug, Cloud Code are highly appreciated, but K8S API definitely MUST be the core part of it - and no one will be giving away that much of control, now since we&#39;ve seen what&#39;s possible!

Use ICICI debit card with international transactions enabled on it. I was working with Firebase and had to setup a billing account at Google Cloud Platform and I used Icici debit card which worked.
Hey Sachin! Thank you for the kind words. <br />The exam I took was all practical based multi-choice. As in, there were two case studies and you had answer questions like:<br />‚ÄúBased on what you‚Äôve read about company X, what setup should they go for?‚Äù<br />A. Big table, cloud storage..<br />B. Big query, cloud spanner<br />...<br />...<br />And you‚Äôd have to pick the best setup based on the information. However, this has changed since March 29 but the new exam style is listed on the certification page, I think they‚Äôve taken away the case studies but it‚Äôs still multi-choice.<br /><br />Updated exam guidelines: <a href="https://cloud.google.com/certification/guides/data-engineer-2/">https://cloud.google.com/certification/guides/data-engineer-2/</a>
@Daniel Bourke Thank you so much for your time and info :) Much Love &lt;3
@sachin prabhu Use an Indian credit card from someone. It works. Debit cards don&#39;t support autodebit and are 3D secure which are not supported in American subscription payment gateways like Apple app store etc.

Nice and very detailed video. Good work.
A data engineer builds applications with data pipelines at the heart of them. From collecting data to manipulating data to using data to drive insight. A data engineer could be responsible for the whole pipeline or a single piece (in a team with other engineers). The cert alone is great but having a project/experience to back up the certificate is even better. You should always favour experience (such as, working on your own projects) over certifications.

Heya, I think that may be out of my wheel house. There are optimization algorithms used in machine learning to deal with gradient descent (how a model learns) but unless that‚Äôs what you‚Äôre talking about we may be thinking different things. Are you talking about optimising predictions? Or something like optimising a process? Like the directions between two points on a map?
This might be of interest to you: <a href="https://deepmind.com/blog/article/traffic-prediction-with-advanced-graph-neural-networks">https://deepmind.com/blog/article/traffic-prediction-with-advanced-graph-neural-networks</a>
@Daniel Bourke The optimization I&#39;m talking about is like what you said, best route between two points with an objective, like best route using minimum fuel or minimum time. <br />Differs from ML because in ML the objective is modeling a precise prediction, optimization is about trimming a problem to a mathematical basis to find the optimal solution.<br /><br />Recently I found a ML approach to optimization in pricing, they train a model to predict sales and experiment different prices in the test data to compare which prices produces the best profit overtime. <br /><br />After asking to you I did some search in udemy and found a nice course on the subject: <a href="https://www.udemy.com/course/optimization-with-metaheuristics/">https://www.udemy.com/course/optimization-with-metaheuristics/</a><br /><br />I asked because I thought it was interesting knowledge to use in data science, and I&#39;ve seen few approaches using it. <br />Thank you
@Daniel Bourke Yes, precisely, very interesting material. They are using MetaGradients to optimize the learning rate, MetaGradient is a optimization technique. Well, I see a lot of ground to explore in ML using optimization techniques to tweak its effectivity.
@Rodrigo Soares so cool! Google just released a paper on building optimizers to optimize themselves: <a href="https://arxiv.org/abs/2009.11243">https://arxiv.org/abs/2009.11243</a> - you might be interested
Hey, mate<br />let me ask you a thing, my undergrads was on applied maths and operations research, it means that what I learned was more focused on the optimization field. <br />Now studying ML and Data Science, I see a lot of prediction and no optimization, can you reference me material related to optimization in data science?<br />best regards!

Great video as usual. I cleared the exam this morning.. Exam tips and resources i used.
 <br />I followed course from Pluralsight, which pretty much covers everything for data engineer exam.
 <br />I additionally used Skillcertpro exam questions for practice. They have around 541 questions. Evaluate yourself by scoring above 85% in these tests before attempting real exam. Most of these questions are very identical to real exam, which helped me to score higher in my main exam,
 <br />All questions comes with detailed explanation at the end. Review them. retake tests multiple times if you&#39;re scoring below 85%. because practicing exam questions is key for passing the real exam. 
 <br />I hope this helps anyone who is planning for certification.
 <br />Feel free to ask any more questions regarding this. Happy to help

Hey Obaidur, You can move your instances between zones, by taking a snapshot of your persistent disks, using the snapshots to launch new instances in the desired zone, and deleting your original resources. If a zone is deprecated, you can use this method to move your instances from the deprecated zone.<br /><br />Hope this helps!

Hey Naveen, Datastore is technology that can store data in relation form(tables, columns, fields..).Datastore can be very broad terminology. It can be a technology that can store both structured or unstructured data.<br /><br />Hope this helps!

@storagefreak Hey man, can you make an tutorial or just tell me how I can get an Windows 10 image or how I can use the free windows 10 and not actually buy a license. Also, if you would make a tutorial i think you will help lots of people, as there`s no such tutorials out there...
Hi Julian! Really good question. Currently available OS images in Google Cloud Compute Engine focuses mostly on &#39;Windows Server&#39; editions. So, from the Windows family you can choose from Windows Server 2008, 2012, 2016, 2019 and so on.<br />You can Import Your own Windows 10 image, and take advantage of &#39;Bring your own license&#39; feature! Read more about it here:<br /><a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instances/windows/">https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instances/windows/</a><br /><br />I&#39;m not sure what you would like to achieve, but there is a good chance, whatever workload You wish to run on Windows 10, you can most likely run it on &#39;Windows Server&#39; edition as well.

Hi Philip, you can turn on and off your VMs in the Google Cloud console, once it&#39;s turn on you can shutdown your laptop/computer and it will not affect the state of your VM. Remember when you want to disconnect from the remote desktop session, use &#39;logout&#39; instead of &#39;shutdown&#39; to keep the VM running :)

Hi Darmin, you are charged in a nutshell by every hour (if I remember correctly - every second to be precise) that the VM is powered on. Check out this article with details <a href="https://cloud.google.com/compute/all-pricing">https://cloud.google.com/compute/all-pricing</a>

Hi Ed, you need &#39;allow http and/or https traffic&#39; only if you want to have port 80(http) and/or port 443(https) opened on Google cloud firewall between your VM and &#39;world&#39;. In other words if you don&#39;t plan to use your VM as a web server there is no need to do it :)<br />Check out my other video about Google cloud firewall rules, I explain that a bit more :)
I noticed that you didn&#39;t click on &quot;Allow http &amp; https traffic&quot; in the section that reads Firewall. Is that because you are using a Microsoft computer already? Or is that because it&#39;s somehow unnecessary? Thanks for the video - short &amp; sweet!
Hi Phat, I don&#39;t think so, but you can check the official docs to validate it :) <br /><a href="http://cloud.google.com/docs/">cloud.google.com/docs/</a>

To the point video. Just what I needed. Just a heads up. While setting up a payment method, use a credit card. A debit card won&#39;t work. i think i got an example, im building an app backend where i need to pull data from an api and generate custom results for each user based on that.<br /><br />i could do this using a couple queues and topics on gcp or i could use this service to pull the data and process it with my cloud functions, after that send a message to my users notifying that the data is available
Suppose you have a claim application where employee raise claims. It is required to integrate claims application with SAP. SAP provides Rest API endpoint for integration.<br />Once claims are approved those claims should be uploaded to SAP at night. <br />You can use Google workflows to get claims from your claim application and then post those claims to SAP each night. <br />First you will create a step in workflow that will read all approved claims from the claim app database.<br />Then for each claim or you can even batch them and then you will post those claims to SAP. <br />Basically this use case is integrating two application: claim app and SAP.
In a nutshell, Workflows allows you to connect ‚Äòthings‚Äô together. Pretty much anything that has a public API. You can connect multiple Cloud Functions together, or mix-match Cloud Functions with Cloud Run services with Google Cloud APIs or even external APIs. This article might give you a better idea: <a href="https://medium.com/google-cloud/a-first-look-at-serverless-orchestration-with-workflows-d80e41e9e04f">https://medium.com/google-cloud/a-first-look-at-serverless-orchestration-with-workflows-d80e41e9e04f</a>

@abhishek mane If a component fails to pass a performance test, it‚Äôs deemed no longer usable. To prevent any sensitive information from living on that disk, we remove it from inventory to be erased and destroyed in Layer 6, Disk Erase.

Lo puedes hacer accediendo por SSH y luego &quot;sudo nano /opt/bitnami/apps/wordpress/htdocs/wp-config.php&quot;. No obstante deber√≠as utilizar una IP est√°tica y en la zona DNS ingresar correctamente los registros A y CNAME, y en unos momentos deber√≠as acceder a tu WordPress sin problemas con el nombre de tu dominio. To clarify, Dedicated Interconnect means setting up a GCP Cloud Router. Cloud Router peers with your on-premises VPN gateway or router. It dynamically advertises routes to your on premise peer.

 <br />define(&#39;WP_SITEURL&#39;,&#39;http://alienseo.page&#39;);. Hola Cristian, los registros DNS para los sitios web, suelen ser de tipo A o de tipo CNAME. Los registros que debes modificar para tu correo son los MX, lo que significa que puedes tener tu correo en un servicio A, tu xsitio web en un servicio B y asi... una cosa no cambia o desconfigura la otra. Si necesitas ayuda te invito a mi comunidad de FB. Saludos!<br /><a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/emprendimientoweb">https://www.facebook.com/groups/emprendimientoweb</a>

They have some crossovers but I think of it like this:<br /><br />Machine learning engineer = combination of data scientist and data engineer, can find insights in data and also deploy them to be used by businesses or customers<br />Data engineer = knows somewhat about using data to gather insights but specialises in creating the infrastructure to build data science pipelines, this usually involves, ingesting data, transforming it and using it to deliver a product or service<br />Data scientist = specialist in getting insights out of data to inform others (usually a team or client) about how a product or service is operating/could be improved<br /><br />Would you like to see a video/article on this in the future?
